Good posture can improve concentration, reduce fatigue, and prevent strain on your body. Follow these steps to ensure proper sitting posture:

1. Sit up straight with your back against the chair and shoulders relaxed.
2. Keep your feet flat on the floor or on a footrest.
3. Position your knees at a right angle, level with your hips.
4. Ensure your chair provides adequate lumbar support.
5. Adjust your monitor so that the top of the screen is at or slightly below eye level.
6. Keep your elbows close to your body and bent at a 90-degree angle.
7. Take regular breaks to stand, stretch, and move around to avoid prolonged static posture.
8. Keep your wrists straight and your hands at or slightly below elbow level.
9. Avoid crossing your legs as it can restrict blood flow and lead to posture issues.
10. Ensure that frequently used items are within easy reach to avoid overreaching.

By following these guidelines, you can maintain a healthy sitting posture and reduce the risk of discomfort or injury.
